title: balance
description: 1. a state where things are of equal weight or force: 2. The balance on a…
text:
balance
nounuk
balance noun (EQUAL STATE)
B2
[[ S or U ]](/es/help/codes.html)
New
[tax](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/tax) [measures](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/measure)are [designed](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/design)to [redress](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/redress)the balance (= make the [situation](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/situation)more [equal](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/equal)) between [rich](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/rich)and [poor](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/poor).
We must
[strike](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/strike)a balance between [reckless](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/reckless) [spending](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/spending)and [penny-pinching](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/penny-pinching)(= [try](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/try)to have something between these two things).
Sinónimo
[equilibrium](/es/diccionario/ingles/equilibrium)formal [[ U ]](/es/help/codes.html)
The balance on a
[piece](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/piece)of [electronic](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/electronic) [equipment](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/equipment)for [playing](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/card) [music](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/music)is the [particular](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/particular) [mixture](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/mixture)of different [sounds](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/sound), or the [device](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/device)that [controls](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/controls)this.
on balance
- He
[lost](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/lost)his balance and [tumbled](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/tumble)over.
- The
[question](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/question) [threw](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/threw)him off balance for a [moment](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/moment).
- Teachers need to
[strike](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/strike)a [delicate](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/delicate)balance between [instructing](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/instruct) [their](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/their) [pupils](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/pupil)and [letting](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/letting)them [discover](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/discover)things for themselves.
- Most
[managers](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/manager), [politicians](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/politician)and [bosses](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/boss)are men - how can women [redress](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/redress)the balance ?
- The
[shift](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/shift)in the balance of [power](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/power)in the [region](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/region)has had [far-reaching](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/far-reaching) [consequences](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/consequence).

Expresiones
balance
verbuk
B2
[[ I or T ]](/es/help/codes.html)
The
[flamingos](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/flamingo)balanced [gracefully](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/grace)on one [leg](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/leg).
B2
[[ T ]](/es/help/codes.html)
to give several things
[equal](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/equal) [amounts](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/amount)of [importance](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/importance), [time](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/time), or [money](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/money)so that a [situation](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/situation)is [successful](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/successful):
I
[struggle](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/struggle)to balance [work](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/work)and [family](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/family) [commitments](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/commitment). [[ T ]](/es/help/codes.html)
Stringent
[measures](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/measure)were [introduced](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/introduce)so that the [government](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/government)could balance [its](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/its) [budget](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/budget)/the [economy](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/economy).
balance the books
[Ver más](/es/diccionario/ingles/balance-the-books)
- Her
[suitcase](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/suitcase)was [precariously](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/precariously)balanced on the [tiny](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/tiny) [luggage](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/luggage) [rack](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/rack)above her [head](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/head).
- A see-saw balances at
[its](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/its) [fulcrum](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/fulcrum).
- The
[wine](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/wine)has just enough [dryness](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/dryness)to balance [its](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/its) [fruitiness](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/fruitiness).
- Discover how
[eating](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/eat) [raw](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/raw) [food](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/food) [helps](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/help)balance [your](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/your) [body](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/body)and [aids](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/aid) [digestion](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/digestion).
- At the
[moment](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/moment)the [election](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/election) [seems](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/seem)balanced on a [knife-edge](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/knife-edge).
